summary: I have gained experience, learned and developed in different sectors and positions throughout my career. What has guided me along the way is creative problem solving, planning and organising to achieve goals and, supporting the development of others, creating the conditions and opportunities to do so.

projects.title: Nourish EU
projects.description:
The biggest challenges facing the EU food sector are obesity and food poverty, but these are also commercial opportunities to develop healthy and affordable foods. 
Nourish.eu is an Erasmus+ Strategic Partnership that developed educational tools to assist the stimulation of Healthy & Creative Food Regions in UK/Northern Ireland, Bulgaria, Hungary and Ireland.
In developing a course that can be integrated into an adult learning system, we have developed a modular curriculum that inspires and engages learners in experiential learning.

projects.title: EFOP-392-16-2017-00028
projects.description:
This project means development for professionals working at local services of the Partner municipalities. 
9 small villages form the consortium which aimed to strengthen the quality and availability of local services, like health care, social care, education, civil services, sport and leisure opportunities and local business development.
The project itself provides more than 500 individual programs for the local community and also for employees of the local human services. Training opportunities, mentoring programs, educational development, awareness-raising actions, cultural activities are the main areas of the program elements.
As the leader of the project, I am responsible for the program-planning, defining the learning goals of the activities, arrangement and monitoring of quality, the impact and the key performance indicators.
I work with more than 20 professionals of the municipalities from various areas and coordinate their work.
The project involves about 10.000 people, from which 3000 are under 14 years old.
The total budget of the project reaches €1.600.000.

projects.title: Everyday Creativity
projects.description:
Boosting creativity and innovation is one of the main challenges of today's society (and implicitly education) on the global level and on the European level as well.

Everyday school-based education practices should seek to enhance creativity to benefit from scientifically proven results of the improved level of creativity at school, such as:
>> wealth (creativity, knowledge and information are intangible assets that can be capitalized on in the age of globalization),  
>> technological advancement (being able to be creative and adapt to the fast changing world),
>> emotional and social fulfilment (as psychology studies underline, creative habits of mind correlate with higher levels of wellbeing).

Moreover, research shows that there is a correlation between creative learning and students’ attainment.
The project aims to increase the creativity and innovation in everyday school practices in schools in four European countries (Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands and Romania) by:
>> providing support and training to teachers to focus on the processes of creative skills development,
>> actively involving teachers and their learners in showcasing and boosting creative practices in their schools,
>> identifying and promoting uptake of creativity-boosting methods and measure, with an emphasis upon everyday school/classroom creative environments,
>> providing teachers and learners with opportunities to develop their own creativity and engage them in reflection upon their own pedagogy and learning strategies.
The first result of the project is already available on the website: online free self-assessment tool for teachers to support self-reflection and self-evaluation 
https://creativeschools.eu/en/self-assessment/self-assessment-tool-for-teachers

projects.title: E4S - Erasmus for Security
International Forestry
projects.description:
This Erasmus+ strategic partnership project was designed and implemented with the cooperation of forestry-education provider VET institutions from Finland, Sweden, Austria, and Hungary.
The project's objective was to increase the labour market relevance of forestry education. Through international cooperation, the project partners developed a curriculum that uses the strength and expertise of the participating stakeholders. 
Training and education need to embrace and facilitate a comprehensive view of the multiple functions of forests to understand and manage traditional and new activities and to address emerging challenges, notably those relating to the forest sector in a green economy.

projects.title: EBBEY: Entering the Bio Based Economy
projects.description:
The AOC Council had been involved with creating practical learning and support materials on Bio-Based Economy to be used directly in and outside the classroom. EBBEY is based on materials developed by Helicon college for their Green Engineering study, designed explicitly for Bio-Based Economy teaching. 

Vocational colleges in the agricultural sector in Europe experience problems in delivering well-qualified workers to innovative companies in the Bio-Based Economy (BBE). In general, teachers do not have the specific training materials at hand directly related to the new BBE. Most VET colleges (EQF3-4) do not have the right and explicit educational materials that fit the BBE challenge.
 
EBBEY involved end-users, teachers and students. The project on the European level provided support for the European objectives of a shared economic vision to create a solid competitive and innovative Europe.

projects.title: PLENTIS
projects.description:
The PLENTIS project would like to help students and teachers with the method and form of educational games. The partnership of this project offers a set of online educational minigames on the topic of agricultural entrepreneurship to develop the entrepreneurial skills and competencies of students of this vocation.

According to the Lisbon Strategy, one of the eight key competencies is the competence collection for entrepreneurship.  As entrepreneurship cannot be identified as one competence but as a set of competencies, the PLENTIS project aims to develop an online educational platform, a gamified competence development land (literally).  With actual content (knowledge base) and individual games to help teachers and students develop essential skills and competencies for entrepreneurship.

profile_positions.description:
As an external expert, I evaluate project plans, progress, and final reports of EU-funded projects in vocational education and the school education sector. Evaluation processes also mean supporting the monitoring activities of the Hungarian National Agency of the Europen Commission's Directorate-General of Education, Youth, Sport and Culture.
As an expert, I have gained considerable experience and up-to-date insight into the latest educational and training trends, methods, and project management techniques.
profile_positions.title: Evaluator expert

profile_positions.description:
I support the development and implementation of corporate development strategies as a project manager and consultant. I work with small and medium-sized enterprises, educational institutions, and public and municipal authorities. 
The development processes I am involved in are complex and strategic, with the responsibility for developing the organisations and their personnel.
Curriculum development for educational bodies and companies is based on the definition of the required and desired learning goals.
profile_positions.title: Founder and project manager
Head of vocational education and L&D

company.name: Agricultural Vocational Centre of Central Hungary

profile_positions.company: Agricultural Vocational Centre of Central Hungary
profile_positions.description:
My primary responsibilities in my job were supporting change and improving staff as the organisation transformed. The school was created by merging four previously independent institutions, where challenges such as different organisational cultures and values, institutional mission, complete isolation, and individual resistance to change had to be addressed.
I developed joint projects for staff based on jointly formulated pedagogical goals, shared implementation experiences, inspiring shared collaboration of working together and getting to know each other.
In addition to this, activities were linked to an international exchange of experience, which I was responsible for fully developing and implementing. I created the content and the organisational framework in the process, which has provided the basis for the organisation's activities in this direction ever since.
profile_positions.title: Learning and development advisor, international project manager

profile_positions.description:
Teacher in general agricultural vocational (ISCED 3 ) and secondary vocational education (ISCED 4). Mentoring students, working on school projects and student entrepreneur projects.
Talent management: identifying talented students, preparing a suitable training program for them individually and in teams, preparing them for competitions.
Trainer in adult learning programs, and short-term competence-development programs.
Teacher in special education program for students with fewer opportunities.
Curriculum development based on the learning goals and the needs of the labour market stakeholders.
Cooperation with the dual training workplaces.
profile_positions.title: teacher, trainer

profile_positions.description:
As a junior HR consultant, I have carried out recruitment, selection, formulating of workforce needs, and identifying training requirements for large manufacturing companies in the region. In doing so, I have carried out the following subtasks: 
- identifying and interviewing suitable candidates using different recruitment channels, 
- Designing and conducting an interview process appropriate to the position, 
- then measuring and assessing the candidates' competencies,
- compiling and forwarding a candidate portfolio to meet the client's needs.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Teaching management sciences, sociology, HR development, and work-organisation for students in BSc and MSc courses. 
Working in team in different research topics like workforce evaluation at agricultural workplaces, adult education and workforce development in animal husbandry, renewed tasks and competency needs in animal husbandry.
Working on individual research topic and write PhD thesis: "A SURVEY OF EMPLOYMENT TRENDS IN CATTLE RAISING FARMS".
profile_positions.title: PhD student
